name: woven bamboo mat production | woven bamboo mat | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24544/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 Kg of woven bamboo mat. To produce woven bamboo mats, a bamboo pole is first flattened and then divided into strips with widths between 2 and 4 cm. These strips are then peeled into 1- to 2-mm-thick veneers, which are then woven to form a mat. The entire process is manual and is typically performed in small, rural communities. The woven bamboo mats are usually used as lightweight walls but have also recently been used for industrially produced panels (Xiao, 2009). Both flattened bamboo and woven bamboo mats are commonly manufactured in facilities extremely close to the point of extraction and/or treatment. The input of flattened bamboo is assumed to have a water content of u = 20%. This is a handcrafted process usually done with hatchets and or other simple tools. The figures origin from mainly calculations and literature values. This dataset was developed with the support of the International Organization for Bamboo and Rattan INBAR;References: ;Liu, X., et al., Nomenclature for engineered bamboo. BioResources, 2015. 11(1): p. 1141-1161.;Xiao, Y. Development of Prefabricated bamboo Earthquake Relief Shelter. in International conference of modern bamboo structures. 2009. Bogot√°, Colombia: Universidad de los Andes.;Zea Escamilla, E. and G. Habert, Environmental impacts from the production of bamboo based construction materials representing the global production diversity. Journal of Cleaner Production, 2013.

From reception of bamboo pole at the processing facility

This activity ends with woven bamboo mat (u = 20%) at the processing facility. The dataset includes the inputs for trimming and, processing, as far as they are available. The dataset does not include infrastructure. This process is considered to be handcrafted, no powertools are used.
